SEARCH
Package AlgorithmCode

Class HashTruthTables

java.lang.Object
AlgorithmCode.HashTruthTables
public class HashTruthTables extends Object
Generates, tests, and displays sets of hash codeword truth tables, where the table is addressed by the integer value of a square binary input neighborhood, and the values are a 4-bit hexadecimal codeword ECA rule minMax pair that minimize and maximize the discrepancies between the input and the ECA output using the codeword as the initial value

  • Field Details

    • rowError

      public boolean rowError
      Whether this instance of the class uses row-weighted or column-weighted errorScores

  • Constructor Details

    • HashTruthTables

      public HashTruthTables(boolean inRowError, Hash inHash)
      Initializes everything to size 4, so truth tables are 65536 long. If you want a different size, run initialize(size). Sizes greater than 5 break the JVM
      Parameters:
      inRowError - whether this instance of the class will use row-weighted errorScores or column-weighted
      inHash - instance of the manager function

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(int size)
      Initializes arrays to size. Sizes above five bust the JVM
      Parameters:
      size - length and width of the input neighborhood

    • findMinimizingCodeword

      public int[][] findMinimizingCodeword(int n, int[][] in)
      Primary hash function. Finds the minimizing and maximizing codewords of input in[][]
      Parameters:
      n - ECA rule 0-255
      in - binary input array
      Returns:
      the array with ECA n and initial neighborhood mimimum output

    • generateCodewordTile

      public int[][] generateCodewordTile(int[] in, int rule)
      Outputs the square array, where row 0 is the input and the rest of the rows are ECA output, with wrapped columns so that it's cylindrical with the rows parallel to the circumference and columns perpendicular. The basic unit of the hash algorithm
      Parameters:
      in - input neighborhood in array form
      rule - ECA 0-255 rule
      Returns:
      the square of the input and its ECA output

    • generateCodewordTile

      public int[][] generateCodewordTile(int inInt, int rule)
      Outputs the square array, where row 0 is the input and the rest of the rows are ECA output, with wrapped columns so that it's cylindrical with the rows parallel to the circumference and columns perpendicular. The basic unit of the hash algorithm
      Parameters:
      inInt - input neighborhood in integer form
      rule - ECA 0-255 rule
      Returns:
      the square of the input and its ECA output

    • generateAddressTile

      public int[][] generateAddressTile(int in, int size)
      For size 4, there are 65536 4x4 binary arrays, this takes in an integer 0-65536 and returns it as a 4x4 binary array
      Parameters:
      in - integer between 0-65536
      size - side length of the square
      Returns:
      the input integer turned into a square binary array of size size

    • addressTileToInteger

      public int addressTileToInteger(int[][] in)
      Takes in a square binary array and returns its value as an integer
      Parameters:
      in - square binary array
      Returns:
      in[][] in integer form

    • addressToArray

      public int[][] addressToArray(int size, int inInt)
      Takes an integer between 0-65536 (for size 4) and returns it as a square binary integer array
      Parameters:
      size - length of the square
      inInt - integer value of the input neighborhood
      Returns:
      the input as a square binary array

    • doAllRules

      public void doAllRules(int size, boolean doChangeScore, int changeScoreTrials, boolean doRandom, int numTrials, boolean doVoting)
      Exhaustively generates all 0-255 ECA rule hash algorithm truth tables and minMax codeword sets; then does some basic analysis on aggregate properties
      Parameters:
      size - side length of the square you want to operate on
      doChangeScore - if this is set, it calls a function that randomly changes the address and sees how much the codeword changes, significantly affects runtime, has not been tested in a while
      changeScoreTrials - if doChangeScore is true this is how may random attempts doChangeScore() makes on a given codeword, significantly affects runtime
      doRandom - size 4 is manageable computationally, larger than that you would want to set this true
      numTrials - if doRandom is set, this is how many random attempts it makes at analyzing a given rule
      doVoting - does voting on reconstruction; has not been tested in a while and may be redundant

    • individualRuleDisplay

      public void individualRuleDisplay(int specificRule, boolean doChangeScore, int changeScoreTrials, int size)
      Displays some basic information about an ECA rule's hash performance statistics
      Parameters:
      specificRule - 0-255 ECA rule
      doChangeScore - whether to check the codeword change / input change
      changeScoreTrials - how many random samples to take if doChangeScore is true
      size - size of the hash tile

    • oneFiftyDisplay

      public void oneFiftyDisplay()
      Displays some nifty information about rule 150's 4x4 hash error heat map involving Pi and the Golden Ratio

    • individualRuleManager

      public void individualRuleManager(int rule, int size, boolean doChangeScore, int changeScoreTrials, boolean doRandom, int numTrials, boolean doVoting)
      Used when calculating an individual rule instead of entire sets; initializes the appropriate arrays
      Parameters:
      rule - 0-255 ECA rule
      size - side length of the square you want to operate on
      doChangeScore - if this is set, it calls a function that randomly changes the address and sees how much the codeword changes, significantly affects runtime, has not been tested in a while
      changeScoreTrials - if doChangeScore is true, this is how may random attempts doChangeScore() makes on a given codeword, significantly affects runtime
      doRandom - size 4 is manageable computationally, larger than that you would want to set this true
      numTrials - if doRandom is set, this is how many random attempts it makes at analyzing a given rule
      doVoting - does voting on reconstruction; has not been tested in a while

    • individualRuleManager

      public void individualRuleManager(int rule, int size)
      Overload of the other individualRuleManager() for simplicity's sake
      Parameters:
      rule - 0-255 ECA rule number
      size - size of the square codeword tile

    • doAllRules

      public void doAllRules(int size)
      Overload of the other doAllRules() for simplicity's sake
      Parameters:
      size - size of the square codeword tile

    • individualRule

      public void individualRule(int rule, int size, boolean doChangeScore, int changeScoreTrials, boolean doRandom, int numTrials, boolean doVoting)
      Generates the entire truth table for a given size of a particular ECA rule, min and max codewords. The doVoting parameter and the vote loops are not considered in the paper, but there experimentally to decrease error. The doChangeScore and changeScoreTrials hash the input, randomly change input and rehash, to see how much the codewords change when the input changes and is not run when simply generating truth tables
      Parameters:
      rule - 0-255 ECA rule
      size - side length of the square you want to operate on
      doChangeScore - if this is set, it calls a function that randomly changes the address and sees how much the codeword changes, significantly affects runtime, has not been tested in a while
      changeScoreTrials - if doChangeScore is true, this is how may random attempts doChangeScore() makes on a given codeword, significantly affects runtime
      doRandom - size 4 is manageable computationally, larger than that you would want to set this true
      numTrials - if doRandom is set, this is how many random attempts it makes at analyzing a given rule
      doVoting - does voting on reconstruction; has not been tested in a while

    • changeChange

      public double changeChange(int rule, int[][] in, int errorIn, int numTrials)
      Checks the mean Hamming distance between minimized codewords when the input array is changed
      Parameters:
      rule - ECA rule 0-255
      in - random input data array
      errorIn - errorScore of the calling function
      numTrials - number of trials to do for the mean (severely impacts runtime)
      Returns:
      the mean Hamming distance between codewords per changeScore
